intro: Artemisia gansuensis var. gansuensis, commonly known as Gansu wormwood, is a perennial herb native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Gansu Province in China. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring silver-gray, aromatic leaves with a strong medicinal scent. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flower heads that bloom in late summer, contributing to its ecological role in stabilizing sandy soils. It is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, thriving in dry and well-drained conditions. This variety is valued for its traditional medicinal uses and is also used in local horticulture for ornamental purposes.
